results.title: ‘A One-Hour Layover Is Not Enough Anymore’: A Flight Attendant’s Tips on Surviving Travel Now
results.abstract: In two decades of flying, things have never been as stressful as they are now, a cabin insider says. Here, her tips from 30,000 feet for avoiding airline chaos this summer.

results.title: A Neurologist’s Tips to Protect Your Memory
results.abstract: A new book by a renowned brain expert says there are a few simple things we can do to prevent memory decline as we age.

results.title: Tony Sirico, an Eccentric Gangster on ‘The Sopranos,’ Dies at 79
results.abstract: A familiar face in Woody Allen movies, he became widely known for his portrayal of Paulie Walnuts on the hit HBO series.

media.caption: Tony Sirico as the gangster Paulie Walnuts on the HBO series “The Sopranos.”

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Columbia University;US News & World Report
results.title: Columbia Loses Its No. 2 Spot in the U.S. News Rankings
results.abstract: U.S. News & World Report announced that it had “unranked” the Ivy League university after being unable to verify its data.

media.caption: U.S. News & World Report has acknowledged that it relies on universities to vet their submitted data, and does not have the resources to conduct independent audits.

results.title: First, the Fish Fell From the Sky. Then They Washed Ashore.
results.abstract: In the past month, dead anchovies have been spotted on the streets of San Francisco. Last week, thousands appeared at the edge of a lagoon about 30 miles north.

media.caption: Thousands of anchovies piled up on the eastern shore of Bolinas Lagoon in Marin County, Calif., at the end of June.

results.abstract: For outfits that call for more than your typical undergarments, there’s tape.

results.title: Jan. 6 Panel Questions Cipollone on Pardons and Trump’s Election Claims
results.abstract: Pat A. Cipollone, the former White House counsel for President Donald J. Trump, appeared before the House committee investigating the Capitol attack for roughly eight hours on Friday.
org_facet: House Select Committee to Investigate the January 6th Attack

media.caption: Pat A. Cipollone, the former White House counsel, during a break in his interview with the Jan. 6 committee on Friday. A spokesman for the panel said it “received critical testimony on nearly every major topic in its investigation.”

results.title: I Don’t Want to See a High School Football Coach Praying at the 50-Yard Line

results.abstract: Longstanding weaknesses in the public health system are giving the virus a chance to become entrenched.

media.caption: B, a medical writer in San Francisco, suspected monkeypox after a blister appeared on his wrist following a sexual encounter. It took nearly two weeks to confirm the case.

results.adx_keywords: Nine-One-One (911) (Emergency Phone Number);Ambulances;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Pennsylvania
results.title: 911 Dispatcher Faces Manslaughter Charge After Failing to Send Ambulance
results.abstract: The authorities in Pennsylvania said the dispatcher told a woman that he would not send an ambulance to her mother unless the mother agreed to go to the hospital. She died the next day.

media.caption: Kelly D. Titchenell told the 911 dispatcher that her mother, Diania Kronk, needed to go to the hospital or “she’s going to die.”

results.title: Susie Steiner, Author of Acclaimed British Crime Novels, Dies at 51
results.abstract: Her books found a worldwide audience, but while she wrote them she had to contend with the loss of her sight and the diagnosis of a brain tumor.

media.caption: The author Susie Steiner, whose Manon Bradshaw detective novels became popular both in England and abroad, in an undated photo.

results.title: What’s Up With the Crazy Housing Market?
results.abstract: Rising mortgage rates. Faltering home sales. Skyrocketing rents. Here’s how to make sense of a baffling real estate market.

media.caption: Igor Popov, the chief economist for Apartment List, thinks the rental market will remain competitive. “Whether a restaurant has a waitlist of 10 people or 30 people, you’re still not getting in for dinner,” he said.
media.copyright: Jason Henry for The New York Times

results.title: At 79, Biden Is Testing the Boundaries of Age and the Presidency
results.abstract: President Biden has said he plans to run for a second term, but his age has become an uncomfortable issue for him and his party.

media.caption: Just a year and a half into his first term, President Biden is already more than a year older than Ronald Reagan was at the end of two terms.

results.adx_keywords: Thrift Shops;Fashion and Apparel;Recycling of Waste Materials
results.title: ‘The Golden Age of Thrifting Is Over’
results.abstract: A glut of fast fashion has made its way into local thrift stores, making it hard for women who have been purchasing secondhand for decades to find quality garments they can wear.

media.caption: In addition to driving up thrift stores’ operating costs, thoughtless donating can make it more difficult for people in search of durable wardrobe staples to find what they’re looking for.

results.byline: By Kate Conger and Lauren Hirsch
results.title: Elon Musk Moves to End $44 Billion Deal to Buy Twitter
results.abstract: In a regulatory filing on Friday, Mr. Musk said Twitter was in “material breach” of the acquisition agreement.

media.caption: A regulatory filing by lawyers for Elon Musk on Friday cited a disagreement over the number of spam accounts on Twitter.
